justification: The article notes that "replay is commonly detected during brief, high-frequency oscillations called sharp wave-ripples (SWRs)", indicating SWRs are the physiological signature used to identify replay events.
It states that neuroimaging analyses "have also been able to capture the sequentiality of fast replay events using magnetoencephalography (MEG)", showing MEG is a method for measuring replay.
The review reports that replay has been detected with "functional magnetic resonance imaging (fMRI)", specifying fMRI as another tool to measure replay activity.
